The caster expends the power points to cast the inscribed spell and then powerpoints to cast the Rune# spell. This rune can only inscribe 1st level spells. The paper can be reused. The rune can be set to affect the reader.

spell.name: Rune II
spell.description: This spell inscribes a spell on a specially prepared piece of paper; i.e., rune paper. The rune can then be used to cast the inscribed spell once. The caster expends the power points to cast the inscribed spell and then powerpoints to cast the Rune# spell. This rune can only inscribe 1st to 2nd level spells. The paper can be reused. The rune can be set to affect the reader.

spell.name: Rune III
spell.description: This spell inscribes a spell on a specially prepared piece of paper; i.e., rune paper. The rune can then be used to cast the inscribed spell once. The caster expends the power points to cast the inscribed spell and then powerpoints to cast the Rune# spell. This rune can only inscribe 1st to 3rd level spells. The paper can be reused. The rune can be set to affect the reader.

spell.name: Rune V
spell.description: This spell inscribes a spell on a specially prepared piece of paper; i.e., rune paper. The rune can then be used to cast the inscribed spell once. The caster expends the power points to cast the inscribed spell and then powerpoints to cast the Rune# spell. This rune can only inscribe 1st to 5th level spells. The paper can be reused. The rune can be set to affect the reader.

spell.name: Sign of Shock
spell.description: A Sign can be inscribed on any "non-mobile" surface and affects the triggering being. A Sign can be triggered by on of the following (decided by caster): time period, certain movements, certain sounds, touch, reading, etc. The Sign is cancelled when the being fails a RR against it. Sign of Stunning stuns the target for 10 min/ 10 failure.

spell.name: Rune VI
spell.description: This spell inscribes a spell on a specially prepared piece of paper; i.e., rune paper. The rune can then be used to cast the inscribed spell once. The caster expends the power points to cast the inscribed spell and then powerpoints to cast the Rune# spell. This rune can only inscribe 1st to 6th level spells. The paper can be reused. The rune can be set to affect the reader.

spell.name: Sign of Fear
spell.description: A Sign can be inscribed on any "non-mobile" surface and affects the triggering being. A Sign can be triggered by on of the following (decided by caster): time period, certain movements, certain sounds, touch, reading, etc. The Sign is cancelled when the being fails a RR against it. Target will flee place of sign for 1 min/ 5 failure.

spell.description: This spell inscribes a spell on a specially prepared piece of paper; i.e., rune paper. The rune can then be used to cast the inscribed spell once. spell.description: A Sign can be inscribed on any "non-mobile" surface and affects the triggering being. Target falls into a sleep from which he cannot be awakened for 10 min/ 10 failure.

spell.name: Lord Research
spell.description: (Spell Law section 9.3) This spell can be used to "research magic items". This type of research is heavily dependent on the world system being used, but we suggest the following guidelines.First, the assumption is made that jewels have a very, very high concentration of essence locked within them. Lord researchers, with the proper equipment and care, can break down jewels and release their essence into other materials at hand, although they have little control over the end result of the process. Thus to perform lord research, an Essence user slowly feed jewels into a forge over the course of several weeks (or more) while casting this spell at least three times a day. A Channeler is required to "sacrifice" their jewels to their god (the jewels are destroyed) while casting this spell at least three times a day. In both cases, the essence locked in the jewels will be released and begin to concentrate in some nearby item.What form this released essence will take is impossible to determine until some time after the process is entirely completed. At that time, the GM should determine randomly what the newly created magic item actually does (its realm of power could be random). Keep in mind that its power and capabilities should be proportional to the number of weeks spent in casting this spell and the number (and value) of the jewels destroyed in supplying it with essence (note that the more essence a jewel has, the more valuable it would normally be).

spell.name: Lord Rune
spell.description: This spell inscribes a spell on a specially prepared piece of paper; i.e., rune paper. The rune can then be used to cast the inscribed spell once. The caster expends the power points to cast the inscribed spell and then powerpoints to cast the Rune# spell. This rune can only inscribe 1st to 20th level spells. The paper can be reused. The rune can be set to affect the reader.

spell.name: Mass Sign
spell.description: The sign of stunning, fear, sleep, blinding or paralysis can affect a number of targets up to the level of the caster before it is canceled.

spell.name: Protection I
spell.description: Subtracts 5 from elemental attack rolls against the protected being and adds 5 to all of the being's RRs vs. spells.

spell.name: Cancel Essence
spell.description: When the caster of this spell is a target of a spell from the realm of Essence, the "incoming" spell must first make an RR before the caster makes an RR. For RR purposes, each spell uses a level equal to its caster's level. If the "incoming" spell passes the RR, it max target the caster of this spell normally; otherwise the incoming spell has no effect on the target.

spell.name: Protection Sphere I
spell.description: Subtracts 5 from elemental attack rolls against the protected being and adds 5 to all of the being's RRs vs. spells.

spell.name: Cancel Mentalism

spell.name: Cancel Channeling

spell.name: Protection Sphere II

spell.name: Dispel Essence Sphere I
spell.description: As Cancel Essence, except for area of effect (centered on the caster), If the radius encounters an already existing spell, that spell must make an RR (with a +30 modifier) or be canceled.

spell.name: Essence Shield
spell.description: Creates a shimmering shield in front of the caster: it subtracts 10 from all frontal Essence attack rolls on the caster (base and elemental). If the caster performs no other actions during a round, he can "parry" one spell attack. Parry consists of subtracting all bonuses that the caster would normally have for his base attack roll form the attack roll made against him.

Parry consists of subtracting all bonuses that the caster would normally have for his base attack roll form the attack roll made against him.

spell.description: Subtracts 20 from elemental attack rolls against the protected being and adds 20 to all of the being's RRs vs. spells.

spell.name: Dispel Channeling Sphere I

spell.name: Protection V
spell.description: Subtracts 25 from elemental attack rolls against the protected being and adds 25 to all of the being's RRs vs. spells.

spell.name: Essence Resistance
spell.description: Target gets a +50 for all RRs vs. Essence spells.

spell.name: Mentalism Resistance
spell.description: Target gets a +50 for all RRs vs. Mentalism spells.

spell.name: Channeling Resistance
spell.description: Target gets a +50 for all RRs vs. Channeling spells.

spell.name: Resistance True

spell.name: Lock
spell.description: Caster can cause any lock he can see within 100' to be locked (the lock is just normally locked and can be opened normally).

spell.name: Magic Lock
spell.description: A door or container can be magically "locked"; the door can be broken normally or the spell can be dispelled; otherwise the door can not be opened.

spell.name: Locklore
spell.description: Give the caster +20 bonus for picking the lock analyzed, and +10 for anyone to whom he describes the lock.

spell.name: Opening I
spell.description: When cast on a lock there is a 20% chance a normal lock will open, and a 45% chance that a Magic Lock will open (failure means there is a 10% chance of setting off attached traps). Rolls are open-ended, and the quality of the lock may modify the roll.

spell.name: Traplore
spell.description: Give the caster +20 bonus for disarming the trap analyzed, and +10 for anyone to whom he describes the trap.

spell.name: Disarm I
spell.description: When cast on a trap there is a 20% chance a normal trap will disarm, and a 45% chance that a Magic Trap will disarm (failure means there is a 10% chance of setting off attached traps). Rolls are open-ended, and the quality of the trap may modify the roll.

spell.name: Jamming
spell.description: Causes a door to expand and jam into its frame (roll 1-100: severity ranges from slightly stuck to unopenable).

spell.name: Weakening
spell.description: Reduces the inherent strength of a door by 50%.

spell.name: Open Prison I
spell.description: When cast, there is a 20% chance that all locks within the area of effect are unlocked (45% chance for Magic Locks). Roll separately for each lock in area of effect. Rolls are open-ended, and sophistication of the lock may modify the roll.

spell.name: Opening II
spell.description: When cast on a lock there is a 40% chance a normal lock will open, and a 90% chance that a Magic Lock will open (failure means there is a 10% chance of setting off attached traps). Rolls are open-ended, and the quality of the lock may modify the roll.

spell.name: Undoor I
spell.description: Will vaporize a nonmagic door up to 6" thick, 10' high and 10' wide (if the door is thicker than 6" it will vaporize the closest 6 inches).

spell.name: Disarm II
spell.description: As Disarm I, except chance is 40% (90% for magical traps).

spell.name: Greater Magic Lock
spell.description: As Magic Lock, except duration is 1 hr/lvl and the chance that an Opening (or Open Prison) spell will work is reduced to 20%

spell.name: True Lock
spell.description: As Magical Locks, except door is unbreakable by normal means.

spell.name: Undoor II
spell.description: Will vaporize a nonmagic door up to 2' thick, 20' high and 20' wide (if the door is thicker than 2' it will vaporize the closest 2 feet).

spell.name: Open Prison II
spell.description: As Open Prison I, except chance is 40% (90% for Magic Locks).

spell.name: Undoor III
spell.description: Will vaporize a nonmagic door up to 3' thick, 50' high and 50' wide (if the door is thicker than 2' it will vaporize the closest 3 feet).

spell.name: Magic Lock True
spell.description: As Magic Lock, except duration is 1 day/lvl and the chance that an Opening spell (or Open Prison) will work is reduced by 40%.

spell.name: Undoor True
spell.description: Will vaporize one door.

spell.name: New Gate
spell.description: A doorway (8' x 5') is created in any wall up to 6"/lvl deep.

spell.name: Lock Mastery
spell.description: Gives the caster a 90% chance of opening a lock. The roll is open-ended and the quality of the lock may modify the roll.

spell.name: Trap Mastery
spell.description: Gives the caster a 90% chance of opening a trap. The roll is open-ended and the quality of the trap may modify the roll.

spell.name: Gate Cleaver
spell.description: Caster can utilize any one of the lower level spells on this list each round.

spell.name: Circle of Protection
spell.description: Everyone in the are of effect receives a bonus to their DB and RRs. If the circle radiates inward then all targets receive a +10 DB and +10 RR. If the circle radiates outward, then all targets receive a +5 DB and +5 RR.

spell.name: Circle of Summoning
spell.description: When a Circle of Summoning is deawn it is dedicated to a type of creature subject to the GMs approval (e.g., animal, demon, elemental, faerie, etc.). While the caster is within the circle he receives a special +35 to his Summoning skill for that particular creature.

spell.name: Circle I
spell.description: Allows up to a 1st level spell to be imbedded into a prepared circle. The spell to be imbedded into the circle must be cast within one minute after the Circle spell.

spell.name: Circle of Containment
spell.description: The caster dedicates the containment circle to a type of creature subject to the GM's approval. Whenever such a creature tries to cross the border of the circle, it must make an RR at -50 or else take a 'C' Impact critical. If the creature makes it's RR, the containment circle is canceled. The caster can summon creatures into a circle of containment.

spell.name: Circle II
spell.description: As Circle I, except up to 2nd level spells can be imbedded.

spell.name: Multi-Circle II
spell.description: Allows the caster to place two circles around each other, therby combining their effects without negating one another.

spell.name: Circle III
spell.description: As Circle I, except up to third level spells can be imbedded.

spell.name: Circle of Pain
spell.description: All within the area of effect must resist of take 10% of their remaining hits every round (they may make a new RR each round).

spell.name: Blazing Circle
spell.description: Caster causes the outline of the circle to blaze in an uneartly fire. Anyone attempting to cross the circle will take an 'A' Heat critical.

spell.name: Circle V
spell.description: As Circle V, except up to 5th level spells can be imbeded.

spell.name: Multi-Circle III
spell.description: As Multi-Circle II, except up to three circles may be placed in conjunction.

spell.name: Circle VI
spell.description: As Circle I, except up to 6th level spells can be imbedded.

spell.name: Circle of Binding
spell.description: Any creature summoned within a Circle of Binding must answer one question, or perform one task for the caster. This spell does not grant the caster the ability to communicate with the creature.

spell.name: Circle VII
spell.description: As Circle I, except up to 7th level spells may be imbedded.

spell.name: Waiting Circle
spell.description: The next imbeded Circle spell effect(s) can be delayed for up to one day per level of the caster, or intil triggered by one of the following (decided at time of casting): specified movements, touch, or a specific action.

spell.name: Power Circle
spell.description: All within the area of effect must make an RR or gain 1 PP per 10% failure for every round they are in the area.

spell.name: Circle X
spell.description: As Circle I, except up to 10th level spells may be imbedded.

spell.name: Power Leech Circle
spell.description: All within the area of efect must make an RR or lose 1 PP per 10% failure for every round they are in the area.

spell.name: Multi-Circle IV
spell.description: As Multi-Circle II, except up to 4 circles may be placed in cconjunction.

spell.name: Circle XII
spell.description: As Circle I, except up to 12th level spells may be imbedded.

spell.name: Circle XV
spell.description: As Circle I, except up to 15th level spells may be imbedded.

spell.name: Power Circle Matrix
spell.description: Allows the caster to "link" multiple circles (each circle must be within half a mile of at least one other circle in the matrix) for the transfer of power points or spells. A spell user in any linked circle may send spells ot power points to any other spell user in a circle within the matrix. The recipient of any spells must cast the spell immediatly as an instantaneous spell. The recipient still may only cast one spell per round and if multiple spells are transferred to him he will cast each in the order they were sent to him. Any soell sent to a recipient must include the appropriate amount of power points, and both the sender and the recipient must make spell casting manuevers to check for spell failure. The size of the matrix is defined when the spell is cast. All circles must already be in okace and thsui spell must be cast at each circle (within one year of the creation of the first piece of the matrix). The maximum size of the matrix is one circle per 10 levels of the caster.

spell.name: Circle True
spell.description: As Circle I, except up to 30th level spells may be imbedded.

notes.note: Circles can be up to 1' radius in diameter per levle of the caster in size. The caster must take 1 minute per 1' radius to draw the circle. Drawing the circle consists of inscribing the circle onto a solid surface. After the circle has been drawn, the Circle spell is cast (as well as any imbedded spell). All circles are immobile once activated. A character may only draw a circle if has a number of ranks in the Circle Lore skill equal to the level of the Circle spell he wishes to cast.

Spells imbedded into circles will either have the duration equal to the duration of the Circle sepll or the normal duration of the spell imbedded, whichever is greater. Only spells of type P, U, F or I may be imbedded into circles.

When a circle is drawn, the caster can choose to have the spell radiate inwards or outwards. For circles that radiate inward, all targets receive a -50 to any applicable RRs. Circles that radiate outwards have a radius of effect equal to 5' per 1' radius of the circle; any targers adjacent to the circle have an additional -25 to RRs rolls (if applicable). All targets within the area of effect are treated as targets for the soekk abd receive the benefits or penalties of the spell for as long as they are within the area of effect.
All effects from a circle will extend to their full area regardless of obstacles.

Crossing a circle delivers 25% of the trespassers's remaining concussion hits in damage if he fails a RR. If the circle is broken at any point (i.e., its inscription is even partially erased or destroyed), the spell is canceled and the caster must rolls for spell failure with a special modifier of +5 per level of the circle spell in the resulting backlash of power.

If the Multi-Circle spell is not used when two or more circles of any type intersect or overlap in physical localtion or effect, both will be canceled (the caster makes an unmodified spell failure roll).

spell.name: Cancel Essence I
spell.description: When a spell of the Essence realm is cast against the caster (of Cancel Essence), the attack spell must first make a successful RR before the caster is forced to make a RR. For the first RR, the attack level is the level of the caster of the Cancel Essence spell, and the defender level is the level of the caster of the attack spell. If the first RR is successful, thane the attack spell proceeds normally.

spell.name: Unessence
spell.description: Target has no Essence power points and thus can throw no Essence spells for 24 hours (includes spells cast using spell bonus items). This can also be cast against items which could normally cast spells.

For the first RR, the attack level is the level of the caster of the Cancel Essence spell, and the defender level is the level of the caster of the attack spell.
